p: Animals pretreated with the extract and the reference anti-nociceptive drug, nalbuphine (10 mg/kg, i.p.), had longer response latency when measured at 1, 2, 3, and 4 h after administration. The effect was significant ( p < 0.001) at all time points for nalbuphine, whereas the effect of the extract was only significant at 3 h post treatment, whereas it increased the latency period 1.9-fold over the control value ( Figure 8B).
